title: Jean Laurent NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Réserve Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Crisper than some other Laurent wines, this textured, mineral Chardonnay is full of acidity and citrus fruits with a poised character. A fresh aftertaste enhances the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2017  Quincy
description: This small vineyard region on the banks of the Cher river is devoted exclusively to Sauvignon Blanc. The producer, one of the top names in the area, has made a ripe, juicy and fruity wine. Richness balances the crisp citrus flavors and delicious tight acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2017 Les Villots Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This ripe rosé is balanced by good acidity. Raspberry fruits dominate along with a crisp texture and an intensely juicy and young aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Kilikanoon 2014 Exodus Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: Amidst plenty of ripe, almost raisined plums and berries is a strong character of charred wood, black olive, coffee and chocolate. The oak influences—from 18 months in French oak—dominates on the palate, threatening to drown out the ripe fruit. Give this some time before that settles. Drink 2020–2030.

title: La Berrière 2017 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
description: Soft, fruity and with open citrus and greengage flavors, this wine is lightly textured and ready to drink. It comes from vineyards around the Grandlieu lake just south of Nantes.

title: Love That Red 2015 Daily Double Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Garden herb, spice and cherry aromas lead to plum and herb flavors that trail on the finish. It doesn't all hang together.

title: Mandois NV Brut Zéro  (Champagne)
description: Although technically this is a Brut Zéro with no dosage, the soft and ripe fruits tells the palate otherwise. This wine is rich, with acidity and hints of maturity in play together. Drink this bottling now.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Thérèse Vineyards Victoria Denice Vineyard Carignane (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The wood-spice aromas are prominent on this bottling, starting with cigar box on the nose, alongside black-plum fruit. The palate also shows a lot of cedar as well as dark-plum and clove flavors.

title: Max Ferd. Richter 2016 Mülheimer Sonnenlay Zepplinlabel Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sunny tangerine and yellow apple flavors are forward and fruity here. It's a pristine, light-bodied wine with balanced sweetness. Fresh but moderate acidity and just a hint of minerality lend to its elegant but uncomplicated feel. Drink now.

title: Monte Volpe 2014 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: Winemaker Greg Graziano put a smooth polish on this medium- to full-bodied wine, adding light oak-spice notes to good, ripe red- and black-cherry and black-olive flavors. A smooth, mouth-filling texture makes it soothing to sip.

title: Negro Giuseppe 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of coconut, leather and camphor slowly take shape. The austere palate offers raw sour cherry, vanilla, espresso and nutmeg alongside tight, grainy tannins that leave a somewhat raspy finish.

title: Oso Libre 2014 Nativo Primitivo (Adelaida District)
description: Elegant baked fruit aromas and gingerbread spice make for a powerful entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe and rich with black currant, roasted berry and grilled fig flavors, dusted with ample baking spice, and cut by a slight acidity.

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2016 Alain Lorieux Expression  (Chinon)
description: This ripe smoky wine is full of red fruits layered with some firm tannins. It has spice, an open and deliciously juicy character, and a short-term aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: A blend from three vineyards, this rounded wine is rich in apple and green-plum flavors, with an edge of spiciness. It is rich enough to be ready to drink now.

title: Paul Buisse 2017 Clos du Gaimont Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Almonds, spice and great fruitiness all contribute to the success of this wine. Acidity keeps it bright while a honeyed edge entices. It is refreshingly ready to drink.

title: Piattelli 2014 Grand Reserve Limited Production Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Minty, cheesy oak notes dampen blackberry aromas and render the nose foresty. A full mouthfeel has its share of pulp, while this Malbec tastes spicy, chocolaty and herbal. Oak takes the reins on a finish that tastes toasty and a lot like chocolate.

title: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Even in this dry Chenin, a hint of honey accompanies the apple fruitiness. A ripe wine, it also has plenty of acidity and attractive layers of fruitiness and almonds, with a crisp texture at the end. Drink now.

title: Primarius 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The aromas of strawberry, herb, cinnamon stick and spice bring appeal. The palate shows an elegant style. The concentration doesn't always seem there, but what is delivers.

title: Proelio 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: An almost-black color and savory, meaty aromas of black fruits and prune announce a saturated Tempranillo with syrupy weight and thickness. Charred flavors of burnt wood and slightly overripe black fruits finish with full tannins.

title: Quinta da Pacheca 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Aromas of geraniums give this wine a very perfumed character that dominates the fruit. It is perhaps all too much, not giving the dusty tannins and berry fruits any room to speak.
